keyMoments.description: Reveals his tragic backstory about how Sanji's wanted poster destroyed his peaceful life
keyMoments.significance: Transforms Duval from a mysterious antagonist into a sympathetic character with legitimate grievances

keyMoments.description: His face is finally revealed, showing an exact match to Sanji's poorly-drawn wanted poster
keyMoments.significance: One of One Piece's most memorable comedic reveals, explaining his obsessive hatred of Sanji

keyMoments.description: After receiving Sanji's Parage Shot, his face is transformed into a handsome appearance
keyMoments.significance: Resolves the conflict and transforms Duval from enemy to ally through an act of accidental kindness

reveals.description: Duval was a small-time bandit whose life was ruined when Sanji's wanted poster was released, as his face matched the poster's poor illustration
His real face is revealed to match Sanji's wanted poster exactly (except eyebrow direction)
His face is restructured by Sanji's Parage Shot, making him extremely handsome

abilities.name: Bull Riding
abilities.description: Rides his pet bison Motobaro as a mount

relationships.description: Duval initially hated Sanji for his wanted poster ruining his life, but became grateful after Sanji's Parage Shot made him handsome
Motobaro is Duval's loyal pet bison who serves as his mount

keyMoments.description: Gets trapped in steel nets by Duval and nearly drowns
keyMoments.significance: Shows Sanji's vulnerability and creates tension in the battle

keyMoments.description: Is rescued by Camie, resulting in a massive nosebleed from being pressed against her chest
keyMoments.significance: Classic Sanji comedy moment showcasing his weakness for beautiful women

keyMoments.description: Uses Parage Shot technique to restructure Duval's face with precision kicks
keyMoments.significance: Debuts a new powerful technique that demonstrates Sanji's surgical precision in combat

abilities.name: Parage Shot
abilities.description: A series of precision kicks targeting specific facial points (Oeil, Nez, Joue, Bouche, Dents, Menton) that can restructure bone and tissue like violent plastic surgery

relationships.description: Unknowingly ruined Duval's life with his wanted poster, then accidentally fixed it with Parage Shot
Camie saved Sanji from drowning, much to his delight

keyMoments.description: Unknowingly uses Conqueror's Haki to knock out Duval's charging bull Motobaro without physical contact
keyMoments.significance: First clear visual representation of Luffy using Conqueror's Haki, though played as comedy and not explained until later

reveals.description: First visible use of Conqueror's Haki (Haoshoku Haki), though Luffy remains unaware of this power

abilities.name: Conqueror's Haki (Unconscious Use)
abilities.description: Unknowingly released Conqueror's Haki to intimidate and knock out Motobaro

keyMoments.description: Reveals and fires the Thousand Sunny's secret weapon, the Gaon Cannon, for the first time
keyMoments.significance: Showcases Franky's genius as a shipwright and the Sunny's full combat capabilities

abilities.name: Gaon Cannon Operation
abilities.description: Can operate the Thousand Sunny's devastating Gaon Cannon that fires compressed air blasts

keyMoments.description: Dives into the water and uses her incredible mermaid speed to rescue Sanji from drowning
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates why mermaids are considered the fastest swimmers in the One Piece world

abilities.name: Mermaid Swimming Speed
abilities.description: As a mermaid, Camie can swim faster than any fish-man or human, allowing her to rescue Sanji from the steel nets

relationships.description: Saved Sanji from drowning when he was trapped by Duval

keyMoments.description: Charges at Luffy but is knocked unconscious by Luffy's Conqueror's Haki without being physically touched
keyMoments.significance: First animal to visibly react to Luffy's Conqueror's Haki, serving as evidence of this power's existence

relationships.description: Motobaro is Duval's loyal pet bison who serves as his mount in battle
